definition: hand/(formal) to hold/person engaged in certain types of work/person skilled in certain types of work/personal(ly)/convenient/classifier for skill/CL:雙|双[shuang1],隻|只[zhi1]
gas/air/smell/weather/to make angry/to annoy/to get angry/vital energy/qi

sentences.english: What will the weather be like tomorrow, Mac?
sentences.chinese: 麥克，明天天手氣怎麼樣？

sentences.english: Kiss the dice for good luck.
sentences.chinese: 爲了好手氣親一下色子吧。

sentences.english: The employer sees all want to go mad, the luck of this young man likewise too favor?
sentences.chinese: 所有人看的都要瘋了，這個年輕人的手氣也太好了吧？

sentences.english: Assume that your luck owe good, even if what you have mastered mahjong skills.
sentences.chinese: 假定你手氣欠好，就算你掌握了多少麻將技巧。

sentences.english: Dont stop me now. Im on a roll.
sentences.chinese: 現在別叫我停，我手氣正好。

sentences.english: Don't stop me here. I'm on a roll.
sentences.chinese: 如今別叫我停，我手氣正好。

sentences.english: I can't wait to test my luck at the mahjong table.
sentences.chinese: 我等不及要在麻將桌上試試我的手氣了。

sentences.english: Don’t stop me now. I’m on a roll.
sentences.chinese: 現在別叫我停，我手氣正好。

sentences.english: I am a good luck, how to play so hard to win?
sentences.chinese: 我是一個老千，怎麼靠手氣打牌那麼難贏呢？

sentences.english: A successful parent tried to pass the 'winning vibe' by shaking hands with those who followed.
sentences.chinese: 一位成功的家長還跟後面的人握手以傳遞好手氣。

sentences.english: Mary usually wins at cards because she always seems to hold a good hand.
sentences.chinese: 瑪麗老是贏牌，因爲她好像總是手氣好。

sentences.english: Do you hate to tempt fate?

definition: to fish in troubled water (idiom); to take advantage of a crisis for personal gain
to eat one's fill/to be full
to try one's luck/to leave sth to chance
Cona county, Tibetan: Mtsho sna rdzong, in Lhokha prefecture 山南地區|山南地区[Shan1 nan2 di4 qu1], Tibet
lit. to rush at thin air/fig. to miss one's aim/to have nothing to show for one's troubles
vocal accompaniment in some traditional Chinese operas/to speak in support of/to chime in
hot pot containing stinky tofu and other ingredients (Taiwanese dish)
lit. bashing sideways and colliding straight on (idiom); to push through shoving and bumping/to barge/to charge around violently
to try to answer a question (in a quiz, guessing game, riddle etc)/quiz game
